page.title: 01Between Grantham-Sleaford
page.content: Most of the land in this rural area is devoted to wheat and barley production. Some beef/dairy cattle, sheep , pigs and horses are kept. Culverthorpe has 13 dwellings and a Hall, overlooking two lakes, with picnic area and countryside walks for the general public. 34 residents include farmworkers, grooms and gamekeeper. Heydour has a farm, Priory and 4 other dwellings. 15 residents include landowners family, builder and retired people. Parish Church has splendid peal of eight bells. Oasby has 54 dwellings, including Manor House, Public House, Post Office and General Stores. 137 residents, maninly business, professional and engineering workers who travel to surrounding towns to work. Some businesses at home produce, sea food merchants,
